pygraphc.clustering.ConnectedComponents module¶

class ConnectedComponents(g)[source]¶

This is a class for connected component detection method to cluster event logs [1]_.

[1]H. Studiawan, B. A. Pratomo, and R. Anggoro, Connected component detection for authentication log clustering, in Proceedings of the International Seminar on Science and Technology, 2016, pp. 495-496.
get_clusters()[source]¶

This method find any connected component in a graph.

A component represents a cluster and each component will be given a cluster identifier.

Returns:clusters – List of cluster list, where each list contains index (line number) of event log.
Return type:list[list]

pygraphc.clustering.KCliquePercolation module¶

class KCliquePercolation(graph, edges_weight, nodes_id, k)[source]¶

Bases: object

This is a class for graph clustering based on k-clique percolation.

The procedure will find k-clique. If there is any percolation between k-cliques, it will be set as a cluster. The unnecessary edges will be removed. The use of this method for event log clustering was presented in [1]_.

References

[1]H. Studiawan, B. A. Pratomo, and R. Anggoro, Clustering of SSH brute-force attack logs using k-clique percolation, in Proceedings of the 10th International Conference on Information Communication Technology and Systems, 2016.
_build_temp_graph()[source]¶

Build a temporary graph to get a percolation between individual k-clique.

_enumerate_all_cliques()[source]¶

Returns all cliques in an undirected graph.

This method returns cliques of size (cardinality) k = 1, 2, 3, ..., maxDegree - 1. Where maxDegree is the maximal degree of any node in the graph.

Returns:generator of lists
Return type:generator of list for each clique.

Notes

Based on the algorithm published by Zhang et al. (2005) [1]_ and adapted to output all cliques discovered. This algorithm is not applicable on directed graphs. This algorithm ignores self-loops and parallel edges as clique is not conventionally defined with such edges. There are often many cliques in graphs. This algorithm however, hopefully, does not run out of memory since it only keeps candidate sublists in memory and continuously removes exhausted sublists.

The original source code is taken from NetworkX development branch [2].

References

[1]Yun Zhang, Abu-Khzam, F.N., Baldwin, N.E., Chesler, E.J., Langston, M.A., Samatova, N.F., Genome-Scale Computational Approaches to Memory-Intensive Applications in Systems Biology. Supercomputing, 2005. Proceedings of the ACM/IEEE SC 2005 Conference, pp. 12, 12-18 Nov. 2005. doi: 10.1109/SC.2005.29. http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/stamp/stamp.jsp?tp=&arnumber=1559964&isnumber=33129
[2]Dan Schult, Source code for networkx.algorithms.clique. https://networkx.github.io/documentation/development/_modules/networkx/algorithms/clique.html
_find_kcliques()[source]¶

Find all k-cliques in a graph.

Returns:kcliques – List of k-cliques found but only return specified k. The frozenset contains nodes identifier.
Return type:list[frozenset]
_get_clusters()[source]¶

Get final result of the k-clique percolation clustering.

Returns:clusters – List of list containing nodes identifier for each cluster.
Return type:list[list]
_get_percolation_graph(kcliques)[source]¶

Get percolation graph.

This temporary graph also well known as percolation graph in the literatures. A node represents a k-clique and an edge will be drawn if there is any intersection between two k-cliques.

Parameters:kcliques (list[frozenset]) – List of all k-cliques found with user-specified k.
_remove_outcluster()[source]¶

Remove edges that connect to other clusters.

This method will first find any edges in the cluster member. If edges connecting to a node does not belong to the current cluster, then it will be removed.

get_clique_percolation()[source]¶

Get all cluster in percolation (temporary) graph.

Returns:clique_percolation – List of nodes in each cluster in frozenset.
Return type:list[frozenset]
get_kclique_percolation()[source]¶

This is the main method to call all k-clique percolation clustering.

Returns:clusters – List of list containing nodes identifier for each cluster.
Return type:list[list]
get_percolation_nodes()[source]¶

Get percolation nodes after finished clustering.

Returns:percolated_nodes – List of all percolated nodes
Return type:list
get_removed_edges()[source]¶

Get removed edges after clustering process.

Returns:removed_edges – List of tuple containing edge from (node1, node2)
Return type:list[tuple]
class KCliquePercolationWeighted(graph, edges_weight, nodes_id, k, threshold)[source]¶

Bases: pygraphc.clustering.KCliquePercolation.KCliquePercolation

This a class derived from KCliquePercolation for the case of weighted graph.

_find_kcliques()[source]¶

This method will find weighted k-clique.

The weight of k-clique is calculated based on the geometric mean of its weights.

Returns:weighted_kcliques – List of frozenset containing nodes identifier for each k-clique found.
Return type:list[frozenset]
